info.name: EcoStruxure™ Asset Advisor Ingress Partner API
info.description:
# Overview EcoStruxure™ Asset Advisor Ingress Partner API allows partners to push data into Asset Advisor platform. This API is available for selected partners based on specific agreements with Schneider Electric. For more information please contact us. ## API overview and usage This API enables the following operation: **Measurements** - Push timeseries measurement values ## How it works There are some constraints to respect when using this API: - Max size content to send is 500 KB - Timeseries sampling period must not be less than 10 minutes - We suggest a publication for a device between each 30 to 120 minutes (standard is 60 min), but at least one publication for a device during the day # Documentation ## How to sign up The current version of the API does not allow subscriptions on demand. Selected partners will be signed up manually, based on specific agreements with Schneider Electric, and will be able to access the API with the following information: **Step 1:** Receive the Exchange URL access for the API product. **Step 2:** [Register or login](https://exchange.se.com) with an Exchange account. **Step 3:** Generate a Personal Access Token (PAT) in the developer portal (API credentials and usage details are also available). ## Catalog Variable catalog for each asset type
Motor **Health** | Identifier | Unit | Max Sampling
Period | Description | | ---------- | ---- | -----------------------: |----------------------------------------------------- | | Motor_ElectricalHealth | | 60 min| Health of the electric part of the motor(stator) | Motor_LoadHealth | | 60 min| Health of the load (fan, pump, …) | Motor_ComponentHealth | | 60 min| Health of the mechanical part of the motor (bearings, …) | Motor_ControlHealth | | 60 min| Health of the devices controlling the motor (drive, soft-starter, …) | Motor_ProcessHealth | | 60 min| Reports issues on the way the asset is operated (pump clogging, overload, …) | Motor_ShaftTrainHealth | | 60 min| Health of the shaft train (unbalance, misalignement, …) | Motor_TransmissionHealth | | 60 min| Health of the transmission (gearbox, belt, …) **Condition monitoring** | Identifier | Unit | Max Sampling
Period | Description | | ---------- | ---- | -----------------------: |----------------------------------------------------- | | Motor_StatorTemperature1 |°C| 15 min| Temperature measured inside the stator windings | Motor_StatorTemperature2 |°C| 15 min| Temperature measured inside the stator windings | Motor_StatorTemperature3 |°C| 15 min| Temperature measured inside the stator windings | Motor_BearingTemperature1 |°C| 15 min| | Motor_BearingTemperature2 |°C| 15 min| **Operating conditions** | Identifier | Unit | Max Sampling
Period | Description | | ---------- | ---- | -----------------------: |----------------------------------------------------- | | CMOT1_Spd |Hz| 5 min| Motor shaft rotation speed | CMOT1_TorqueLevCoef |Ratio| 5 min| Motor torque as a ratio of the rated torque of the motor | CMOT1_NbStartTtl | | 24 h| | OpTime |s| 24 h| Operating time of the motor **Electrical measurements** | Identifier | Unit | Max Sampling
Period | Description | | ---------- | ---- | -----------------------: |----------------------------------------------------- | | I |A| 5 min| Average of the 3 RMS currents | VLLAvg |V| 5 min| Average of the 3 RMS phase to phase voltages | PFTtl |Ratio| 5 min| Total power factor on the 3 phases | WTtl |W| 5 min| Total active power on the 3 phases | Hz |Hz| 5 min| Frequency of the supply voltage applied to the motor | WHr |Wh| 24 h| Cumulated active energy consumed by the motor | VARHr |VARHr| 24 h| Cumulated reactive energy consumed by the motor **Environment** | Identifier | Unit | Max Sampling
Period | Description | | ---------- | ---- | -----------------------: |----------------------------------------------------- | | T_ambient |°C| 15 min| Ambient temperature in the place where the motor operates | THUM1_RelHumAmbient |Ratio| 15 min| Ambient relative humidity
Transformer **Usage** | Identifier | Unit | Max Sampling
Period | Description | | ---------- | ---- | -----------------------: |----------------------------------------------------- | |MoistureContent|%| - | |OilTemperature|°C| - | Oil temperature measured by the sensor at top/bottom dependent on installation point |HotSpotTemperature|°C| - | Temperature at the hotspot. |LVHotspotTemperature|°C| - | |MVHotspotTemperature|°C| - | **Tank** | Identifier | Unit | Max Sampling
Period | Description | | ---------- | ---- | -----------------------: |----------------------------------------------------- | |OilTankCoverTemperature|°C| - | **Aging** | Identifier | Unit | Max Sampling
Period | Description | | ---------- | ---- | -----------------------: |----------------------------------------------------- | |WindingInsulationAging|%| 24h | |LifeLeft|years| - | Life left of the transformer at normal stress **Risk Score** | Identifier | Unit | Max Sampling
Period | Description | | ---------- | ---- | -----------------------: |----------------------------------------------------- | |Operating_RS| | - | The risk of the transformer failing according to the current operating conditions below. This risk is equivalent to the worst case of the sub-indices below with escalation if there are multiple sub-indices at the same level. |Droplet_RS|| - |The risk of water droplet formation given hotspot temperatures and water content of the paper |CO2-CO_RS|| - |Ratio of carbon oxide gases indicating the risk of accelerated cellulose aging due to contact with hot metal based on oil test |HotspotTemperature_RS|| - |Maximum computed hotspot temperature in the last six months |WaterContentOil_RS|| - |Computed maximum instantaneous water content in oil computed from measured Temperature and Water Activity overlaid with WCO from offline oil test |BreakdownVOltageOil_RS|| - |Relative breakdown voltage of oil compared to new oil due due to moisture in oil moisture |WaterIngressRisk_RS|| - |The risk that water has found its way into the tank and is increasing moisture levels in the oil and paper. |Dielectric_RS|| - |This risk is equivalent to the worst case of the sub-indices below with escalation if there are multiple sub-indices at the same level. |C2H2_RS|| - |The level of acetylene in the latest oil test indicating the risk that electrical arcing resulting from the breakdown of the insulation |H2_RS|| - |Levels of H2 in oil according to dissolved gas analysis. When the H2 option is installed, H2 in the oil is measured. |DegreePolym_RS|| - |The degree of polymerization derived from the measured online data |PartialDischarge_RS|| - |High levels of hydrogen in the oil test indicates the risk of partial discharges resulting from dielectric breakdown. Future roadmap will compute this score from correlating data from the PD Sensor and H2 measurements |WaterContentPaper_RS|| - |The water content of the paper derived from the measured data |WaterContentOil_RS|| - |Computed maximum instantaneous water content in oil from measured Temperature and Water Activity overlaid with WCO from offline oil test |Acidity_RS|| - |From oil test |InsulationQuality_RS|| - |Computed from Degree of Polymerisation, WCO and Acidity. |SolidInsulation_RS|| - |This risk is equivalent to the worst case of the sub-indices below with escalation if there are multiple sub-indices at the same level. |Bubbling_RS|| - |The risk of bubble formation given hotspot temperatures and water content of the paper |CO_RS|| - |A carbon oxide indicating gassing from the breakdown of cellulose in contact with the hot metal |CO2_RS|| - |A carbon oxide indicating gassing from the breakdown of cellulose in contact with the hot metal |CH4_RS|| - |The level of hydrocarbon gas can indicate gassing from the breakdown of cellulose in contact with the hot metal |C2H4_RS|| - |The level of hydrocarbon gas can indicate gassing from the breakdown of cellulose in contact with the hot metal |C2H6_RS|| - |The level of hydrocarbon gas can indicate gassing from the breakdown of cellulose in contact with the hot metal |Aging_RS|| - |This risk is equivalent to the worst case of the sub-indices below with escalation if there are multiple sub-indices at the same level. |LifeLeft_RS|| - |Years left until the solid insulation has reached the end of life. |AgingRate_RS|| - |Scores the risk to the rate of aging of the transformer insulation over 5 years. |AgingVolatility_RS|| - |The increase in the rate of aging as a result of growth in load over the observation period (up to 5 years), taking into account variability in load, as high volatility in the load can increase the risk of accelerated aging. (Standard deviation of load change). **Water** | Identifier | Unit | Max Sampling
Period | Description | | ---------- | ---- | -----------------------: |----------------------------------------------------- | |TopWaterActivity|| - |Water activity at the top. |BottomWaterActivity|| - |Water activity at the bottom. |WaterContentOil|ppm| - |Water content in oil computed from temperature and water activity
## Support Contact the Schneider Electric Exchange support team at exchange.support@se.com and include: - Endpoint URL - Request/Response of the URL - Any additional information like Screenshots, Postman collections, etc. --- Visit the community to discover related discussions and questions. Contact Support: Name: Get Support on this API Email: exchange.support@se.com
